metadata.title: CVE-2024-53141 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: ipset: add missing range check in bitmap_ip_uadtWhen tb[IPSET_ATTR_IP_TO] is not present but tb[IPSET_ATTR_CIDR] exists,the values of ip and ip_to are slightly swapped. Therefore, the range checkfor ip should be done later, but this part is missing and it seems that thevulnerability occurs.So we should add missing range checks and remove unnecessary range checks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-233-generic - 4.15.0-233.245~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-233-generic - 4.15.0-233.245~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-233-lowlatency - 4.15.0-233.245~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1177-aws - 4.15.0-1177.190~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-gcp - 4.15.0-1170.187~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-oracle - 4.15.0-1139.150~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-263.297').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-233.245~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1141.152').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1178.193').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.190~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1185.200~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.187~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1139.150~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
